metadata.title: CVE-2020-36241 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
autoar-extractor.c in GNOME gnome-autoar through 0.2.4, as used by GNOMEShell, Nautilus, and other software, allows Directory Traversal duringextraction because it lacks a check of whether a file's parent is a symlinkto a directory outside of the intended extraction location.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36241` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gnomeautoar-0.1 - 0.2.3-1ubuntu0.1
gir1.2-gnomeautoargtk-0.1 - 0.2.3-1ubuntu0.1
libgnome-autoar-0-0 - 0.2.3-1ubuntu0.1
libgnome-autoar-gtk-0-0 - 0.2.3-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-autoar package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.3-1ubuntu0.1').
